As an Australian, if I place my money in a Citibank account here, they will pay me over 8% interest.
 
 But then they will loan out money to Americans at 6.5% interest.
 
 In theory, can a person or group of people essentially borrow money in the US, lend it back to the same organisation here, and make a tidy profit at virtually no risk, aside from exchange rate swings?
 
 Even if this is logistically difficult for an individual or small group, surely institutions can cut these sort of deals quite easily, and perhaps at better rates.
 
 In other words, don't centrally directed interest rates create enormous arbitrage opportunities? Or am I missing something?

 That is what the yen carry trade was pretty much all about. Borrow yen at 1% then deposit it in the US or other high yielding country at 5% and pocket the difference, so the answer to your question is yes.
 
 The problem is that exchange rate swings are a HUGE risk. Changes in the value of the dollar have wiped out, and in many cases put into negative territory, most of the carry trade.
That is one way Keynes made money. And to think of it, investing in the ForEx, is not much different than what you are describing.

They also loan it out at 12 to 21% with their credit cards. Banks also borrow a majority of their capitol from the US Federal Reserve at 1 to 2%. I don't know if Citibank does, but a few major banks also operate national chain pawn shops and check cashing places like Cash America, which is one step above loan sharking.

 What you're missing: you dismiss the exchange rate swing risk. That can be HUGE.
 
 And you can't try to put on forward contracts to eliminate the risk, because the pricing of forward contracts reflects the interest rate differential such that no arbitrage is possible*.
 
 * The one condition when it is possible is when a particular borrower has unusually preferential conditions in one market - but such preferential conditions automatically enable arbitrage anyway.

The rest of the value is planned to withdraw from federal budget! To put it in plain words, someone will merely sack that heap of money!! That's our money! They money we pay as taxes! Damn it! I wish I never paid taxes 'cause my heart is bleeding when I see it wasted like that!
